text:
vel one hospitals should refer to level two or three hospitals if:
o they do not have the resources for appropriate investigation and management,
o diagnosis of the underlying cause is not readily determined, or
o there is evidence of organ dysfunction (jaundice, renal impairment, respiratory distress, or neurological
problems).
• For chronically unwell women, there should be a low threshold for admission for inpatient investigation and
management.
